Welcome to Jin Chai page.

I am researcher at SNU now.

I am an Postdoctoral Fellow of Epidemiology and Population Health at Albert Einstein College of Medicine in Bronx, NY.

I study the association between metabolomcis and chronic disease in the large cohort studies.

I have interested in the bioinformatics, biostatistics, data analysis, and data visualization using R language. Also, interested in the GWAS, multi omic integrationm machine learning , and so on.

Highlighted Publications

Plasma Lipidomic Profiles and Risk of Diabetes: 2 Prospective Cohorts of HIV-Infected and HIV-Uninfected Individuals

Zhang and Chai et al. The Journal of Clinical Endocrinology & Metabolism (2021)

Serum sphingolipids and incident diabetes in a US population with high diabetes burden: the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

Chen and Chai et al. The American Journal of Clinical Nutrition (2020)

Lipidomic profiles and progression of carotid artery atherosclerosis in HIV infection: Two prospective HIV cohorts

Chai et al. JAMA Cardiology (2019)
